name: Beef Penaeg (gang panaeg neua)
recipeIngredient: 3 long red or green chilies (cut in half and deseeded,
large handful of thai basil leaves.
7 dried long red chilies (deseeded, soaked and drained),
1 tsp scraped and chopped coriander root,
recipeInstructions: 1. First make the paste. Boil the peanuts for at least 30 minutes until very soft, drain and cool. Pound or blend the paste, adding the peanuts last.

2. Blanch the meat from a cold water start (to soften it’s flavour) and rinse. Bring the coconut milk to the boil, add the beef, then turn down the heat and braise gently until tender (about 2 hours). Allow to cool in the liquid, then remove and slice.

3. Crack the coconut cream by simmering over a medium heat, then fry 4 tbsp of the paste in the coconut cream for 10 minutes. Season, first with palm sugar, and then, after a minute with the fish sauce. Moisten with 3 cups of coconut milk. Add the sliced beef, simmer briefly to heat through, and finish with the remaining ingredients.
